Functions
CHECK_IF_EXIST
int CHECK_IF_EXIST(
const char *word,
FILE *fptr
)

Check The existence of a word by counting its occurences in a file.

Parameters
word
const char*

The word we're trying to search for in the file.

fptr
FILE*

The pointer to the file we're searching in.

Returns
If the Word exist within the file

Returns the number of occurences.

If The Word does not exist

Returns 0

DELETE_LINE
void DELETE_LINE(
FILE *srcFile,
FILE *tempFile,
const int line
)

Deletes a specific line in a file by copying all the content of the file (line by line) except the line we wish delete to a temporary file which in his turn get's renamed with the oldfile name after it get's removed.

Parameters
srcFile
FILE*

The pointer to the oldfile that will be removed afterwards.

tempFile
FILE*

The pointer to the newfile that will be renamed into the oldfile afterwards.

line
const int

The line number we wish delete in the file.

char *Customize_Name(

)

Customize the filename for each user ,It will be used to name a text file with the exact name of the word it takes as a paramater

Parameters
name
char*

The name of the member that we try to create a personalized custom file for.

Returns

The personalized filename with the member name.

CHANGE_OR_DELETE_DATABASE_LINE
void CHANGE_OR_DELETE_DATABASE_LINE(
char Delete_Modify,
Member_credentials *ADHERANT_CREDENTIALS,
FILE *srcFile,
FILE *tempFile,
const int line
)

This functions is used on Double mode especially to interact with the member credentials Database:

Delete Mode

It deletes a specific line from the The Database.

Modification Mode

It modifies a specific line in the Database

The way it operates is similar to DELETE_LINE using a source file and a tempfile.

Parameters
Delete_Modify
char

It denotes The mode which will the function be used in i.e: "D" for delete /"M" for modify

ADHERANT_CREDENTIALS
Member_credentials*

The structure of the members which will be holding the new infos when the user try to modify his/her credentials

srcFile
FILE*

The pointer to the oldfile that will be removed afterwards.

tempFile
FILE*

The pointer to the newfile that will be renamed into the oldfile afterwards.

line
const int

The line number we wish delete/modify in the file.

void CHANGE_OR_DELETE_INFOS_LINE(
char Delete_Modify,
Member_infos *ADHERANT_INFOS,
FILE *srcFile,
FILE *tempFile,

This functions is used on Double mode especially to interact with the member infos Database:

Modification Mode

The way it operates is similar to DELETE_LINE using a source file and a tempfile.

It denotes The mode which will the function be used in i.e: "D" for delete /"M" for modify

ADHERANT_INFOS

The structure of the members which will be holding the new infos when the user try to modify them.

srcFile
FILE*

The pointer to the oldfile that will be removed afterwards.

tempFile
FILE*

The pointer to the newfile that will be renamed into the oldfile afterwards.

line

CHANGE_OR_DELETE_FILM_DATABASE_LINE
void CHANGE_OR_DELETE_FILM_DATABASE_LINE(
char Delete_Modify,
Film_Infos *FILM,
FILE *srcFile,
FILE *tempFile,
const int line
)

This functions is used on Double mode especially to interact with the Film Database:

Delete Mode

It deletes a specific line from the The Database.

Modification Mode

It modifies a specific line in the Database

The way it operates is similar to DELETE_LINE using a source file and a tempfile.

Parameters
Delete_Modify
char

It denotes The mode which will the function be used in i.e: "D" for delete /"M" for modify

FILM
Film_Infos*

The Film structure which will be holding the new infos when the user try to modify the Film

srcFile
FILE*

The pointer to the oldfile that will be removed afterwards.

tempFile
FILE*

The pointer to the newfile that will be renamed into the oldfile afterwards.

line

The line number we wish delete/modify in the file.

CHANGE_COPIES_NUMB_LINE
int CHANGE_COPIES_NUMB_LINE(
char Borrow_Return,
Member_infos *ADHERANT_INFOS,
Borrowing_Infos *LOAN,
Film_Infos *FILM,
FILE *srcFile,
FILE *tempFile,
const int line
)

This functions is used on Double mode especially to interact with the Film Database:

Borrow Mode

Borrowing a film will increment the number of the available copies

Return Mode

Returning a film will decrement the number of the available copies

The way it operates is similar to DELETE_LINE using a source file and a tempfile.

But It handles also the borrowing guidelines by checking if the category of the film corresponds to the member.

Parameters
Borrow_Return
char

It denotes The mode which will the function be used in i.e: "B" for borrow /"R" for return

ADHERANT_INFOS
Member_infos*

The member info structure used to inform us on the member category.

LOAN
Borrowing_Infos*

The Loan structure to hold the Borrowing infos i.e: Date ,Code ...

FILM
Film_Infos*

The Film structure which will be holding the film infos

srcFile
FILE*

The pointer to the oldfile that will be removed afterwards.

tempFile
FILE*

The pointer to the newfile that will be renamed into the oldfile afterwards.

line
const int

The line number we're trying to update the remaining copies within the file.

Returns

It returns the number of remaining copies of a film in the file used to indicate two types of error :

If the user tried to borrow a film not adapted to his/her category

Returns -2

If the user tried to borrow a film which it's remaining copies are exhausted

Returns -1

See Also :

Current_Date
